intro: Hedypnois hedypnois, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Hedypnois hedypnois is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
